intro: Hieracium guadalopinum, commonly known as the Guadalopin dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the island's unique climate. Hieracium guadalopinum is often found in open habitats such as coastal areas and cliffs.
